==== July 2009: Booth at the 2009 O'Reilly Open Source Convention ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:booth_corner.jpg|photo from OSCON 2009 booth]]</nowiki>
|}
We manned a booth at the O'Reilly Open Source Convention (OSCON) in San Jose and handed out about 200 CDs during the two-day Expo Hall. Our booth was one of the more popular ones; we showed off Ubuntu Netbook Remix and did a raffle for the new edition of The Official Ubuntu Server Book.

==== April/May 2009: Release Parties for Jaunty ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:la_jaunty_party.jpg|attendees at the Jaunty release party in LA]]</nowiki>
|}
To celebrate Jaunty's release, we had a number of activities across the state. For southern California, we held another food/party one with about 14 people attending. In the North, we had parties in <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-May/000555.html|Walnut Creek]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-April/000527.html|San Francisco]]</nowiki>, and Felton.
** <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-JauntyRelease|Project page]]</nowiki>
** Mailing list discussions: <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-March/000461.html|Jaunty Release Activities]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-April/000500.html|SF Jaunty release party]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-April/000513.html|9.4 Launch Party?]]</nowiki>

==== February 2009: Booth and Global Bug Jam at the 2009 Southern California Linux Expo ====
Once again we had a booth at SCaLE.  This weekend coincided with another Global Bug Jam, and we attempted to weave the two together with mixed results.  The booth was great and we handed out about 150 CDs over the weekend, but the Bug Jam was a total flop.

==== June 2008: Presentation at the North Orange County Computer Club ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:noccc_presentation.jpg|photo from NOCCC presentation]]</nowiki>
|}
The North Orange County Computer Club asked us to give a presentation about Linux and Ubuntu.  There were about 50 people in attendance and we handed out a number of CDs and business cards.  The audience was mostly unaware of Linux and open source in general, and seemed enthusiastic about the concept of Linux.

| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:barcampla4.jpg|Joe, Nathan, Neal, and Seth at BarCampLA|width=320]]</nowiki>
